Class WalkingBomb

java.lang.Object
model.WalkingBomb
public class WalkingBomb extends Object
Represents a remote-controlled bomb that the player can move independently from the Hero.

A WalkingBomb behaves similarly to the hero in terms of collision: it has a hitbox, respects map boundaries, and only moves over walkable tiles. Movement is controlled through dedicated bomb-movement keys handled by KeyHandler (bombUpPressed, bombDownPressed, bombLeftPressed, bombRightPressed).

The bomb does NOT explode automatically. Detonation is triggered externally by GameModel when keyH.detonatePressed becomes true. The explosion has an extended radius (cross shape, distance 2).

  • Field Details

    • hitBox

      public Rectangle hitBox
      Collision hitbox relative to (x,y). Used to check tile collisions in the same way drones/Hero are handled.

    • spriteUp

      public BufferedImage spriteUp
      Upwards-facing sprite.

    • spriteDown

      public BufferedImage spriteDown
      Downwards-facing sprite.

      public BufferedImage spriteLeft
      Left-facing sprite.

      Right-facing sprite.

  • Constructor Details

    • WalkingBomb

      public WalkingBomb(int startCol, int startRow, GameModel gm, KeyHandler keyH)
      Creates a WalkingBomb at a specified tile position.
      Parameters:
      startCol - the initial tile column
      startRow - the initial tile row
      gm - reference to the GameModel
      keyH - controller handling movement input

  • Method Details

    • setSprites

      public void setSprites(BufferedImage up, BufferedImage down, BufferedImage left, BufferedImage right)
      Assigns directional movement sprites to this walking bomb.
      Parameters:
      up - sprite when moving up
      down - sprite when moving down
      left - sprite when moving left
      right - sprite when moving right

    • getCurrentSprite

      public BufferedImage getCurrentSprite()
      Returns:
      the sprite representing the bomb's current facing direction

    • getTileRow

      public int getTileRow()
      Returns:
      the bomb's current tile row

    • getTileCol

      public int getTileCol()
      Returns:
      the bomb's current tile column

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Returns:
      the bomb's pixel X position

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Returns:
      the bomb's pixel Y position

    • isExploded

      public boolean isExploded()
      Returns:
      true if the bomb has already exploded

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the walking bomb's movement and position, based on input.

      - Reads bomb-movement keys (not hero keys). - Performs tile-based collision checks. - Updates tileCol/tileRow using the bomb's center pixel. - Clamps position within map bounds.

    • explode

      public void explode()
      Detonates the walking bomb, destroying tiles and damaging entities in an extended cross-shaped radius of 2 tiles.

      Explosion effects include:

      • Destroying tiles at (center ± 1) and (center ± 2) along row/column.
      • Damaging and marking drones in the affected cross.
      • Damaging the hero if standing in the explosion radius.
      After exploding, the walking bomb no longer updates or draws movement frames.
